comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Yes, I'm thinking Upper Lake at Glendalough, near this streetview.

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
Welcome Back, hope you had a very nice break. I am still waiting on the post card, but then the post can be slow these days and if you are like me you probably only got around to sending them on the last day.

My first thought is Lough Tay in Wicklow? there is a Guinness owned house there now which was previously owned by the Powerscourt estate, I think the house is called Luggala? 

EDIT - Glendalough looks a better bet [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/peter1892]

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: Oh. I was thinking Lough Mask. I'll have to see if I can find a streetview. Glendalough looks pretty much like it though.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The young man has his right trouser leg clipped up, I'd say he rode his bike up there. Not a trip for a "child".

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: So, are we all happy enough about it being Glendalough for me to add it to the map, and tinkle our Location Identified Bell?

comment.author: 99002941@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] Definitely Glendalough, if you've ever shot there the light on the right when facing out towards the upper part plays havoc with exposures. The white out on the right suggests our intrepid photographer had the same problem I did when I was there anyway! - www.flickr.com/photos/99002941@N08/9298368785/

comment.author: 80456351@N00
comment._content: I hope you had some lovely time away, and of course you missed us.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
